newsitem.title: USA: CBOT rice closes down as market remains rengebound.
newsitem.headline: CBOT rice closes down as market remains rengebound.

text.p: CBOT rice futures closed lower and the market remained rangebound, traders said.
"The market is just marking time and waiting for the report," a trader said.
USDA's September crop report is slated for release on September 11.

The market remains underpinned by strong cash premiums with the narrow spread continuing to indicate near-term supply is tight. September/November traded at five cents, premium September, they said. Overseas markets remain quiet and are providing no direction.
Rice futures volume was estimated at 100 contracts, up from 79 Tuesday. Rice options volume was estimated at 10 contracts, down from 16 Tuesday.
Rice futures closed three to five cents per cwt lower, with September down three at $10.31 per cwt.
